case_title: FAZAL-E-HADI vs NATIONAL ACCOUNTABILITY BUREAU, SINDH through Director-General, Sindh and another
respondant: National Accountability Bureau, Sindh through Director-General, Sindh

accussed_details.name: Fazal-e-Hadi
allegation: Demanding illegal gratification of Rs. 1 million or Toyota Corolla GLI car
Corruption and corrupt practices under Section 9(a)(i) and punishable under Section 10 of NAB Ordinance, 1999

complaint_summary: The complainant, Zafar Baloch, alleged that Fazal-e-Hadi demanded Rs. 1 million or a Toyota Corolla GLI car to exclude his name from an inquiry and soften the role of his colleague Shahid Raza.
investigation_summary: A trap team supervised by Judicial Magistrate Asim Lodhi recovered Rs. 200,000 of tainted money from Fazal-e-Hadi's possession during a raid. Recovery memo was prepared, and the accused was taken into custody. Fazal-e-Hadi admitted to receiving illegal gratification and offered plea bargaining of Rs. 745,700, including Rs. 650,000 as illegal gratification and 15% NAB accidental charges.
judgment_summary: The court found prima facie evidence against Fazal-e-Hadi, including possession of tainted money, plea bargaining affidavit, and handwritten admission of guilt. Minor contradictions in the prosecution's case were deemed insufficient to discredit the evidence. Bail was refused as corruption by NAB officials undermines the institution's credibility.

defense: Contradictions in prosecution's case, including delayed statement of complainant (8 days) and lack of expert verification of telephonic transcripts.
No mention of illegal demand in complainant's initial application for pardon.
Discrepancies in raiding report and reference.
Stereo-type warrant of arrest and procedural flaws, including the return of the seized car to the applicant's wife after 36 days.
prosecution: Corroborated evidence, including recovery of tainted money and independent witness testimony from Judicial Magistrate.
Affidavit of plea bargain dated 14th July, 2007.
Handwritten letter by the applicant admitting mistakes and requesting pardon.
Letter dated 21st May, 2007 showing applicant authorized as Investigating Officer.

assets: Toyota Corolla GLI car (returned to wife of accused after 36 days)

witness_statement.Zafar Baloch: Alleged demand of Rs. 1 million or Toyota Corolla GLI car by Fazal-e-Hadi.
witness_statement.Mr. Asim Lodhi: Supervised raid and recovery of Rs. 200,000 from accused.

legal_terms.Plea Bargaining: An agreement in a criminal case where the defendant admits guilt in exchange for a lesser punishment.

words_and_phrases.Tainted Money: Money obtained through illegal means and used as evidence in corruption cases.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves allegations of corruption against Fazal-e-Hadi, an Assistant Director at NAB Sindh. Evidence includes recovery of tainted money, plea bargaining admission, and corroborated witness testimony. Bail was refused due to prima facie evidence of guilt and the undermining of NAB's credibility by its officials.
